story_sessions.story_text: You find yourself standing in the middle of a dense forest, surrounded by towering trees that block out most of the sunlight. You've been searching for the old mansion all day, and finally, you see it in the distance. The once-grand estate looms before you, its windows like empty eyes staring back. You can't shake the feeling that someone - or something - is watching you. As you approach the entrance, you notice a piece of paper tacked to the door. It reads: 'Turn back now while you still can.'
choices: Search the perimeter for any clues

new_locations.The Old Mansion: A grand estate with a dark history

context_update.key_event: You receive an ominous message

previous_choices: Search the perimeter for any clues
story_sessions.story_text: As you continue to search the perimeter of the grand estate, you notice a subtle change in the atmosphere. The trees seem to be leaning in, as if they're trying to listen in on your every move. You can't shake off the feeling that you're being watched. Suddenly, your phone buzzes with an ominous message: 'They're waiting for you inside.'
choices: Investigate the main entrance and try to find a way in
Search the perimeter some more, looking for any hidden passages or alternative entrances
Return to the starting point and regroup, trying to make sense of the message

context_update.key_event: You receive an ominous message

story_sessions.story_text: You find yourself standing at the entrance of Ravenswood Asylum, a crumbling mansion on the outskirts of town. The once-grand building looms before you, its walls covered in ivy and moss. A chill runs down your spine as you push open the creaking front door, the sound echoing through the empty halls. You've heard rumors about the asylum's dark past - patients went missing, doctors performed twisted experiments, and the hospital was shut down due to unspeakable atrocities. Your goal is to uncover the truth behind Ravenswood's downfall. As you step inside, a musty smell wafts up, making your stomach turn.
choices: Head straight to the basement where the most disturbing experiments were said to take place
Explore the abandoned wards on the upper floor

new_locations.Entrance Hall: The grand foyer of Ravenswood Asylum

context_update.key_event: You've entered Ravenswood Asylum

previous_choices: Explore the abandoned wards on the upper floor
story_sessions.story_text: As you venture deeper into the darkness of Ravenswood Asylum, the air grows thick with the scent of decay and rot. The flickering fluorescent lights above cast eerie shadows on the walls, making it seem as though the very spirits of the former inmates are watching your every move. You've just explored the abandoned wards on the upper floor, but you've yet to uncover the secrets that lie within.

choices.text: Investigate the patient records in the administrative office
choices.description: Head towards the cramped office where patient records and files are stored. Could this be a lead to understanding the asylum's history and the events that led to its downfall?

choices.text: Search for a way out of the upper floor
choices.description: The corridors seem endless, but you're determined to find a way back down to the entrance hall. Every step feels like a betrayal, as if the asylum itself is trying to keep you trapped.

choices.text: Explore the rooms of the former patients
choices.description: You've heard whispers of the inhumane treatments and experiments conducted on the inmates. Are you prepared to face the remnants of their sanity and suffering?

new_locations.Administrative Office: The cramped office where patient records and files are stored

context_update.key_event: Your footsteps echo down the deserted corridors

previous_choices: Explore the abandoned wards on the upper floor
Unnamed action
story_sessions.story_text: As you continue down the deserted corridor, your footsteps seem to echo off the walls. You can't shake the feeling that you're being watched. You've been exploring Ravenswood Asylum for what feels like hours, but you still haven't found any sign of life or explanation for why you're here. The air is thick with the scent of decay and rot, and you can hear the distant hum of old machinery. Your heart racing, you approach a door at the end of the hall that reads 'Administrative Office'. You push it open, and find yourself in a cramped room filled with rows of dusty file cabinets and a large desk where a single chair sits.
choices: Begin searching through patient records and files for clues
Search the office for any signs of what happened to the patients and staff
Leave the office and continue exploring other parts of the asylum

new_characters.Dr. Emma Taylor: A former psychiatrist who used to work at Ravenswood Asylum, known for her unconventional methods

story_sessions.story_text: As you delve into the patient records, your eyes land on 'Patient 13', a file shrouded in mystery. The name seems to send a chill down your spine. Dr. Emma Taylor's journal entry attached to the file catches your attention: 'Subject 13 exhibited unusual behavior, defying all logic. I began to question my own sanity.' You can't shake off the feeling that this patient might be more than just a footnote in Ravenswood Asylum's history.
choices: Continue searching through patient records for any clues about Patient 13
Head back to the Entrance Hall, feeling uneasy and unsure what to do next

context_update.key_event: Patient 13's file has left you with more questions than answers.

story_sessions.story_text: As you continue to delve into the depths of Patient 13's file, you begin to notice a peculiar trend. The record appears to be from an earlier era, with notes written in a handwriting style that seems almost... childlike. You can't shake off the feeling that this file holds more than just medical information. It feels like it might hold a key to understanding the mysterious circumstances surrounding Ravenswood Asylum's downfall.

story_sessions.story_text: You woke up in the dimly lit room, your memories hazy from a night of drinking at the local bar. The last thing you remembered was walking home alone after a particularly grueling shift at work. Now, you found yourself in a cramped, run-down motel room with peeling paint and a single, flickering bulb hanging from the ceiling. Your head pounded, and your mouth felt dry and sticky. A small, dusty TV sat in the corner of the room, playing a low-volume broadcast of a news channel. The anchor's voice droned on about a series of bizarre disappearances in the nearby town of Ravenswood. As you struggled to sit up, you noticed a piece of paper on the bedside table with a single sentence scrawled in red ink: 'They're coming for you.'

choices.text: Try to call for help using your phone
Investigate the TV broadcast for more information about Ravenswood
Search the room for any clues or useful items
choices.action: Begin a search of the motel room

previous_choices: Watch the news channel
story_sessions.story_text: You've been watching the news channel for hours, but you can't seem to shake off the feeling of unease. The report on the Ravenswood Motel had been vague, but it seemed like a small town with a dark history was plagued by mysterious occurrences and unexplained disappearances. You couldn't help but wonder if there was any connection between this place and your own recent troubles.

choices.text: Check out the motel room again for any clues
choices.action: Search the motel room for any signs of disturbance or hidden messages

choices.text: Get some rest, maybe the morning will bring new answers
choices.action: Try to get a few hours of sleep before deciding what to do next

choices.action: Pack your bags and leave the motel room behind

Inside, you find a cryptic note that reads: 'They're watching from the shadows.' The message sends a chill down your spine. You can't shake off the feeling that you're being stalked.

choices.text: Go to the back of the motel room to see if there's any sign of disturbance

story_sessions.story_text: As you stood in the dimly lit front desk area, the clerk's nervous gaze met yours. The cryptic note, now crumpled on your counter, seemed to mock you from beneath its creased surface. You had asked her about the motel's dark history, but she had changed the subject, her voice barely above a whisper.

choices.text: Press her for more information about the motel's past

story_sessions.story_text: As you continue to question the clerk, Liz's nervous demeanor becomes even more pronounced. She glances around the cluttered front desk, as if ensuring no one is listening in on your conversation. 'I-I told you, sir,' she says softly, her voice barely above a whisper. 'There have been... incidents at this motel before.'

choices.text: Press Liz for more information about the incidents

story_sessions.story_text: As you finished asking Liz about the motel's history, her nervous demeanor seemed to intensify. She glanced around the cluttered front desk area, as if ensuring they were truly alone. 'I-I should tell you more,' she stammered, 'but I don't know how much I should say.' Her voice was barely above a whisper, and her eyes darted towards the back of the motel room, where you had discovered the cryptic note. The message still lingered in your mind: 'They're waiting for you in the dark.' Liz took a deep breath and leaned in closer, her voice dropping to an even quieter tone.

She fidgets with her hands and avoids eye contact, glancing around the motel room as if she's worried someone is watching. You press her for more information about the note, but she seems reluctant to share anything further. Just as you're about to give up, she leans in close and whispers, 'You shouldn't be here. This motel has a... history.' She glances around nervously again before adding, 'I'll tell you more if you're willing to listen.'

story_sessions.story_text: As you continue to question Liz about the motel's history, her nervous demeanor only intensifies. She glances around the room as if searching for an escape route, before focusing back on you. 'We've had... issues in the past,' she says quietly. 'Guests have reported strange occurrences - doors opening and closing by themselves, disembodied noises, that kind of thing.' She leans in closer, her voice barely above a whisper. 'And then there was the incident with the girl from room 217.'

story_sessions.story_text:
As you finished speaking with Liz about the girl from room 217, your eyes drifted toward the storage space behind the motel room. The dimly lit area seemed to be calling to you, its secrets and mysteries waiting to be uncovered. You felt an inexplicable pull, as if something inside those old boxes and dusty trunks was trying to get your attention.

Liz's nervous demeanor only added to your unease. She kept glancing over her shoulder, as if she feared being watched by an unseen presence. You began to wonder if the mysterious figure lurking in the shadows had been watching you too, waiting for its moment to strike.

Your skin crawled as you pondered what secrets might be hidden within those storage boxes. Suddenly, your phone buzzed with an incoming call from an unknown number. The display read 'Motel Operations' and showed a single word: 'Room 217'.

Do you:

choices.text: Answer the call and ask about room 217

story_sessions.story_text: As you finished inquiring about the motel's history, Liz's eyes seemed to glaze over, as if she was recalling a traumatic memory. She took a deep breath and composed herself, her voice barely above a whisper. 'Room 217... it's been abandoned for decades. They say that room is cursed.' Her words sent shivers down your spine. The mysterious figure watching you from the shadows seemed to sense your unease, its presence growing more oppressive by the second.

story_sessions.story_text: You decide to make your way to room 217, despite feeling uneasy. As you walk down the long corridor, the air seems to grow even more thick with tension. You can't shake off the feeling that you're being watched. When you arrive at room 217, you notice that it's slightly ajar. You push it open and step inside. The room is dimly lit, but you can see old furniture covered in dust. Suddenly, you hear a faint whispering in your ear. It sends shivers down your spine. You spin around, but there's no one there. The whispering grows louder, and you feel an overwhelming urge to leave. But as you turn to go back, you notice something that makes your blood run cold.

story_sessions.story_text: You stand before the ancient wooden gates of Brindlemark, a village shrouded in mist and legend. The air is heavy with the scent of damp earth and decaying leaves. As you approach the entrance, a gust of wind whispers secrets in your ear, and the trees seem to lean in, as if sharing a mysterious tale. The villagers, huddled within their homes, watch with curious eyes as you arrive. They've been waiting for you, though they don't know why.

Explore the village without announcing your presence

story_sessions.story_text: The villagers, still wary of your presence, begin to close in on you. One by one, they step forward, their faces a mix of curiosity and suspicion. The village elder, a wise woman with eyes like the mist-shrouded mountains, steps forward and clears her throat to speak. 'We have called you here today, not as guests, but as seekers of answers,' she says, her voice steady and calm. 'The villagers have long whispered tales of a chosen one, destined to unlock the secrets of our land. We believe you may be that one.'

story_sessions.story_text: The villagers' demands hung in the air like a challenge. The elder, sensing your resolve, nodded slightly and began to speak. 'We have lived here for generations, yet our history has been shrouded in mystery.' She paused, collecting her thoughts before continuing. 'There was a time when our village was not alone. A powerful force once dwelled within these lands, one that shaped the course of our destiny.' Her words were laced with a mix of nostalgia and unease. The villagers seemed to sense this, their curiosity piqued.

story_sessions.story_text: The villagers' discontent simmered just below the surface as they murmured among themselves. The elder's words had indeed sparked a mix of emotions, but it was clear that many were still grappling with the weight of their own desires for answers. As night began to fall, the village elder called upon you once more. 'Tonight, I sense that you are not yet satisfied with the path we have chosen,' she said, her eyes glinting in the firelight. 'I shall reveal one more secret to you, but be warned: the truth may be more than you can bear.'

story_sessions.story_text: You find yourself standing in front of the old mansion, its grandeur and beauty now shrouded in an aura of mystery and neglect. The once-manicured lawn is overgrown with weeds, and the windows are like empty eyes staring back at you. You've been invited to this mysterious place by a letter from an unknown sender, with only a cryptic message that reads: 'The truth about your past awaits.' As you approach the entrance, the massive wooden door creaks as it swings open, inviting you inside. The air inside is thick with dust and the stench of decay. You step into the foyer, your eyes adjusting to the dim light, and notice a chandelier hanging from the ceiling, its crystals dulled by years of grime. To your left lies a grand staircase, curving upward like a ghostly ribbon. Ahead of you, a door seems to lead into a study or library of some sort. You can't shake the feeling that you're being watched. Your mood is still neutral.

story_sessions.story_text: You are Jack, a former Special Forces operative turned mercenary. Your skills in combat and tactical strategy have made you a valuable asset to those who hire you. You've received a message from an old acquaintance, Victor, who has a lucrative job offer that requires your unique set of skills. The message reads: 'Meet me at the Red Diamond Casino in Macau. I have a mission that requires your expertise.' You arrive at the casino and spot Victor near the poker tables. He's dressed in a tailored suit and looks like he means business. As you approach him, you notice a group of heavily armed men eyeing you from across the room.

story_sessions.story_text: You find yourself standing at the edge of a dense forest, the trees towering above you like sentinels. The air is crisp and clean, filled with the scent of pine and damp earth. You've been searching for weeks, following every lead, every hint, every rumor that might bring you closer to your goal. And now, finally, you've arrived at the entrance to the forest, a place rumored to hold the secrets you seek. Your name is Eira Shadowglow, and you're a skilled adventurer and explorer, feared by some and respected by others in the realm of Tethyr.

choices.text: Push forward into the forest, following the worn dirt path that leads into the trees
Search the edge of the forest for any clues or signs of danger before proceeding

story_sessions.story_text: You stood at the edge of Ravenswood Asylum, the crumbling structure looming before you like a specter from the past. The once-grand entrance now hung crookedly from its hinges, creaking ominously in the wind. You had always been drawn to the supernatural and the occult, and this notorious asylum was rumored to be one of the most haunted places on earth. As a renowned paranormal investigator, you aimed to uncover its darkest secrets. Your team of experts followed closely behind, their equipment at the ready. Dr. Samantha Taylor, your trusted colleague, handed you a dusty old map, her eyes locked onto yours with a mixture of concern and determination.

The once-white walls now bear scars of peeling paint and rusted medical equipment. You've been warned not to venture in, but curiosity got the better of you. The air is heavy with the stench of decay, and an eerie silence greets you like a shroud. A faded sign on the wall reads 'Welcome to Ravenswood Asylum: Where Sanity Fades Away'. Your footsteps echo through the deserted hallways, casting long, ominous shadows on the walls.

story_sessions.story_text: You stepped off the train and onto the worn platform, the scent of damp earth and saltwater filling your lungs. The small coastal town of Ravenswood lay before you, its Victorian-era buildings seeming to lean in as if sharing a secret. You'd arrived in response to a cryptic letter from your estranged cousin, Emily, who'd been missing for three months. The letter spoke of an ancient artifact hidden within the town's walls, and a warning that you should investigate before it was too late.

The handwriting was shaky and barely legible, but it seemed to be a warning: 'They're watching from the shadows.' You showed the message to the station master, who looked nervous and fidgety. He leaned in close and whispered, 'Be careful, stranger. There are things in this town that would make your blood run cold.'

story_sessions.story_text: As you step out of Ravenswood Station, the crisp morning air carries the whispers of the town's secrets. The worn platform creaks beneath your feet, and the misty veil surrounding Ravenswood shrouds everything in mystery. You decide to visit Emily's loved ones, hoping they might shed some light on her disappearance. After asking around, you're directed to the local inn, where a figure named Old Man Jenkins is said to reside. Upon entering the dusty, old inn, you notice a peculiar atmosphere. The air is heavy with the scent of decay and forgotten stories. A hunched figure sits by the fireplace, puffing on a wooden pipe.  As you approach, the figure looks up, revealing a face etched with deep lines and age spots. His eyes seem to hold a thousand tales, but none are shared with you.  'You're looking for Emily,' he says in a voice like gravel, 'but do you really know what you're getting yourself into?'

story_sessions.story_text: You sat down across from Old Man Jenkins at a wooden table in the Ravenswood Inn's dimly lit common room. The fire crackled, casting flickering shadows on the walls as he poured you a cup of tea from a worn tin can. 'So, what do you know about Emily's disappearance?' he asked, his voice low and gravelly. He took a sip of his own tea before continuing, 'She was last seen leaving the Ravenswood Station, heading towards the old mill on the outskirts of town.' Old Man Jenkins's eyes seemed to cloud over as if remembering a painful memory. 'The mill has been abandoned for years. Few dare to go near it after dark.'

story_sessions.story_text: You left Old Man Jenkins' hut, your mind reeling from the hint about Emily's secret. He had mentioned a 'dark legacy' in Ravenswood's past, something that had driven people away for generations. You couldn't shake off the feeling that there was more to this town than met the eye. As you walked towards Ravenswood Inn, the setting sun cast long shadows across the streets. The innkeeper, Mrs. White, greeted you with a mixture of curiosity and suspicion. 'You're still asking about Emily's disappearance,' she said. 'What do you want to know?' You showed her the letter Emily had written before she vanished, seeking answers about Ravenswood's dark history. Mrs. White hesitated for a moment before handing you an old book from the inn's library. 'This might help,' she said quietly. The book was bound in black leather and adorned with strange symbols that seemed to shift as you turned it.

story_sessions.story_text: As you move cautiously forward, the dense foliage of The Forest closes in around you. You've been walking for hours, but the trees seem to stretch on forever, making it impossible to gauge your progress. Suddenly, a faint rustling noise catches your attention. You freeze, holding your breath, waiting to see what will emerge from the underbrush.

choices.text: Investigate the source of the noise

story_sessions.story_text: As you continue forward, the trees seem to close in around you, casting long, ominous shadows on the forest floor. Your cautious mood grows thicker, every snap of a twig or hoot of an owl making you jump. You've been walking for hours, and the sun is beginning to set, casting a golden glow over the dense thicket of trees.

story_sessions.story_text: As you venture deeper into the forest, the dense canopy overhead filters the sunlight, casting the forest floor in a dim, emerald green glow. The air is heavy with the scent of damp earth and decaying leaves. You can hear the distant rush of water, a reminder that the forest's secrets may lie by its source. Your cautious pace has served you well thus far, but the silence is beginning to unnerve you.
